editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msItem.p: fol. i was once pasted down, but was written on at an earlier date. fol. iiv blank.

physDesc.p: Two originally separate volumes, one main one and the fragment of another, together early.

supportDesc.extent: 249 leaves (ii + 247) 320 210 the edges lightly retrimmed and stained yellow.
supportDesc.collation: a bifolium, 1–1612, 176, 18–2012 / 2112, a singleton; I has framed catchwords and pencilled quire-signatures of the usual late medieval form.

binding.p: s. xv, heavily restored: cushion-bevelled oak boards with slightly projecting foredges, now bare; two straps from shallow recesses in the front board to catches on the back, all gone. Rebacked with modern vellum; sewn on six bands. On the rear board, near the foot, is the mark of the large ?brass chain-staple. Possible marks on fol. 247v of the large iron chain-staple. A brass chain-staple was once at the foredge of the front board, near the foot.

history.provenance: On fol. i are a number of partly-obliterated notes: at the head ‘Liber M. Willelmi Reed x E ’; the remains of an early table of contents; a single-line note of s. xiv ‘ Ioh. Malteby nuper defunct requiescat in pace’. At the head of fol. 1 is ‘Liber’, s. xiv, followed by a thorough erasure. On fol. iv: all in the hand of Walter Robert, ‘Liber M. Willelmi Reed socii domus scolarium de Merton’ in Oxon’ quem emit ibidem a quodam stacionario de bonis sibi datis per reuerendum dominum suum M. Nicholaum de Sandwico. Oretis igitur pro singulis supradictis.’; ‘Liber domus scolarium de Merton’ in Oxon’ in communi libraria eiusdem et ad usum communem magistrorum et sociorum ibidem studencium cathenandus. Ex dono uenerabilis patris domini Willelmi tercii episcopi Cicestrie. Oretis igitur pro eodem et benefactoribus eiusdem ac fidelium animabus a purgatorio liberandis. Walterus Roberti.’; ‘xxvii uolumen.’ For Reed, fellow from 1344 until at least 1357, d. 1385, see MS 8. This was apparently one of the books willed by him to the College. Between the first and second inscriptions, probably in Reed’s hand, is a lengthy table of contents, including the first art. of II.
On fol. 247 ‘Istum librum fecit reparari M. Ioh. Burbage sacre pagine professor’. For Burbage, see MS 3.
On fol. ii: ‘N. 3. 9. Art:’, s. xvii, canc. and replaced with ‘A. 3. 9 (XXXV)’, in red; ‘M. A. 4’, canc. and replaced with ‘M. 7’, s. ?xvii. ‘9’ is inked near the foot of the foredge, upside down.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine
msItem.title: Hypomnesticon
msItem.rubric: Aurelii Augustini doctoris egregii contra quinque hereses ypponosticon id est abbreuiatus liber incipit
msItem.incipit: Aduersarii catholice fidei
msItem.finalRubric: Aurelii Augustini doctoris contra Pelagianos et Scelestianos Ypponosticon liber explicit
msItem.note: CPL 381; ed. J. E. Chisholm (2 vols, Paradosis 20–1: Fribourg, 1967, 1980), II, pp. 101–72.

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine (Quodvultdeus)
msItem.title: Aduersus Quinque Hereseos
msItem.rubric: Aurelii Augustini doctoris egregii contra quinque hereses liber incipit
msItem.incipit: Debitor sum fratres factor
msItem.explicit: qui credentes in se custodit in secula seculorum

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De Fide Rerum Inuisibilium
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber beati Augustini de fide rerum inuisibilium
msItem.incipit: Sunt qui putant Christianam religionem propterea ridendam

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De Decem Chordis (Serm. 9)
msItem.rubric: In nomine Domini nostri I. C. incipit sermo sancti Augustini de decem cordis
msItem.incipit: Dominus et Deus noster misericors et miserator

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De Genesi contra Manicheos
msItem.rubric: Aurelius Augustinus doctor egregius iam in Affrica constitutus de genesi duos libros apertissime editos aduersum Manicheos in defensione ueteris legis quam uehementi studio oppugnabant
msItem.incipit: Si eligerent Manichei quos deciperent
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber creature celi et terre Sancti Augustini episcopi contra Manicheos

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De Natura Boni
msItem.note: Preceded by the relevant extract from Retract
msItem.rubric: Aurelii Augustini doctoris egregii incipit prologus in librum de natura boni contra Manicheos
msItem.incipit: Liber de natura boni aduersum Manicheos
Summum bonum quo superius non est Deus est
msItem.explicit: celestem uitam eternam que proponant. Amen.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber sancti Augustini de natura boni contra Manicheos

msItem.author: Ps.-Augustine (Vigilius Thapsensis)
msItem.title: Contra Felicianum
msItem.rubric: Incipit disputatio Aurelii Augustini doctoris egregii contra Felicianum hereticum de Trinitate
msItem.incipit: Extorsisti mihi dilectissime fili
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit disputatio sancti Augustini cum Feliciano heretico

msItem.title: Sermo Arianorum
msItem.incipit: Dominus noster I. C. Deus unigenitus

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Contra Sermonem Arianorum
msItem.rubric: Aurelii Augustini doctoris Ipponensis episcopi contra istam Arrianorum perfideam liber incipit
msItem.incipit: Eorum precedenti disputacioni
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber sancti Augustini contra Arrianorum perfidiam

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: Contra Aduersarium Legis et Prophetarum
msItem.rubric: Aurelii Augustini doctoris egregii contra aduersarium legis et prophetarum liber primus incipit
msItem.incipit: Librum quem misistis

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De Praedestinatione Sanctorum
msItem.rubric: Aurelii Augustini doctoris liber primus incipit de predestinacione sanctorum ad Prosperum et Ylarium
msItem.incipit: Dixisse quidem apostolum scimus

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De Dono Perseuerantiae
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber secundus de bono perseuerancie
msItem.incipit: Iam de perseuerancia diligencius disputandum est

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De Anima et eius Origine
msItem.rubric: Aurelii Augustini doctoris de natura et origine anime ad Renatum liber incipit
msItem.incipit: Sinceritatem tuam erga nos Renate

msItem.author: Augustine
msItem.title: De Haeresibus
msItem.rubric: Epistola Quoduultdeus diaconi ad beatum Augustinum
msItem.incipit: Domino merito uenerabili et uere beatissimo
Domino sinceriter dilectissimo et condiacono

msItem.author: Anselm
msItem.title: Meditatio 3
msItem.incipit: Anima christiana de graui morte resuscitata
msItem.explicit: quia tu es cum Patre et Spiritu Sancto Deus solus benedictus in s. s. amen

msItem.author: Hugh of St Victor
msItem.title: Commentary on Ps.-Dionysius, De Hierarchia Caelesti
msItem.incipit: Iudei signa querunt et Greci sapientiam
msItem.note: PL 175. 923–1154; Goy, p. 190. Passages of text and commentary alternate, the text in larger script on alternate lines.

msItem.author: Giles of Rome OSA
msItem.title: De Corpore Christi Theoremata
msItem.incipit: Quia inter cetera sacramenta ecclesie eucaristie sacramentum plus difficultatis continere uidetur
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus de corpore Christi editus a fratre Egidio Romano fratrum heremitarum ordinis Sancti Augustini. Deo gratias.
msItem.note: pr. Bologna 1481 &c.; Glorieux, Théol. 400i. The theorems are written in larger script on alternate lines.

layoutDesc.layout: Written space 225 135–45 , ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 50 lines (58 fols. 133–56 = quires 12–13). Double lines were ruled right across the page for running heads, supplied spasmodically in later hands.

decoDesc.decoNote: Large red and blue flourished initials; blue initials flourished in red.

origin.origPlace: England, probably professionally made at Oxford

msItem.author: John Holywood
msItem.title: Algorismus
msItem.incipit: (Beg. impf. at 139; edn. p. 194 line 416) et spissitudinem ita numerus
msItem.explicit: tam in numeris quadratis quam cubicis. Explicit.
msItem.note: ed. F. Saaby Pedersen, Petri Philomenae de Dacia et Petri de S. Audemaro Opera Quadrivialia 1 (Corpus Philosophorum Danicorum Medii Aevi 10. 1–2: Copenhagen, 1983–4), pp. 174–201; eTK 0991A; Sharpe, Handlist , p. 306.

msItem.title: De Compositione Quadrantis
msItem.incipit: Post chilindri compositionem et officium eiusdem
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit compositio chilindri cum arte sua que composita fuit Oxonie
msItem.note: unpr.; eTK 1062E, listing another three English copies; additional copies are in Bodl. Libr., Digby 2 and 98. Accompanied by tables.

msItem.title: Treatise on the quadrant
msItem.incipit: Scito quod quadrans est quarta pars circuli continens 90 gradus
msItem.explicit: colloca margaritam in paralello ut supra
msItem.finalRubric: Et in hoc expletur doctrina quadrantis Deo gratias
msItem.note: Accompanied by large tables in red and black.

msItem.title: Regula quadrantis
msItem.incipit: Cum secundum diuersos diuersimode sciencia quadrantis describatur
msItem.note: Accompanied by large tables in red and black.

msItem.author: John Holywood
msItem.title: De Sphaera
msItem.incipit: Tractatum de spera quatuor capitulis distinguimus dicentes primo quid sit spera
Spera igitur ab Euclide sic describitur
msItem.explicit: aut mundana machina dissoluitur. Deo gracias.
msItem.note: ed. J. Thorndike (Chicago ILL, 1949); eTK 1577L. With circular diagrams.

msItem.author: John of Seville
msItem.title: On the Astrolabe
msItem.incipit: Astrologice speculacionis exercicium habere uolentibus
msItem.explicit: (ends impf.) De scriptis predictis restat alancabuth quod interpretatur aranea
msItem.note: ed. J. Millás Vallicrosa, Las traducciones orientales en los manuscritos de la Biblioteca Catedral de Toledo (Madrid, 1942), pp. 316–21; eTK 0156D, 0156I; Carmody 170. With circular diagrams. fol. 247v blank.

layoutDesc.layout: Written space 250 160–80 , ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 47 lines.

handDesc.handNote: Rotunda bookhands of Italian or southern French appearance.

decoDesc.decoNote: Plain red initials and rubrics, often omitted.
